summary: This measure introduces a new definition for "low-speed electric bicycle" as a two or three-wheeled vehicle with fully operable pedals and an electric motor of less than 750 watts, whose maximum speed on a paved level surface is less than 20 miles per hour. This measure also amends the definition of "motor vehicle" to exclude low-speed electric bicycles. Additionally, it modifies the definition of "motorized bicycle" to exclude low-speed electric bicycles, and revises the definition of "motorcycle" to exclude motorized bicycles and low-speed electric bicycles. This measure further introduces exemptions for low-speed electric bicycles in the definitions of "motorized scooter" and "motor vehicle". The new provisions aim to provide clarity and consistency in the regulation of low-speed electric bicycles, distinguishing them from other types of vehicles. This measure has an effective date of: no date specified.
